node.title: Tributes flow for The Last Picture Show, Paper Moon director Peter Bogdanovich, dead at 82
node.alt: A man wearing a navy green coloured suit sitting in a chair, wearing black-rimmed glasses
node.description: Cinephile and director Peter Bogdanovich, known for his work on 1970s black-and-white classics like The Last Picture Show and Paper Moon, dies aged 82.Â
node.content:
["Cinephile and director Peter Bogdanovich, known for his ascot ties as well as his 1970s black-and-white classics The Last Picture Show and Paper Moon, has died aged 82.\u00a0\u00a0", "His daughter Antonia Bogdanovich said he died of natural causes in his Los Angeles home on Thursday morning.\u00a0", "Considered part of a generation of young \"New Hollywood\" directors, Bogdanovich was heralded as an auteur from the start.", "His work included the chilling lone shooter film Targets\u00a0and American coming-of-age drama The Last Picture Show in 1971.", "This evocative portrait of a small, dying town earned him eight Oscar nominations, winning two, and catapulted him to stardom at the age of 32.", "Bogdanovich followed The Last Picture Show with the screwball comedy What's Up, Doc? starring Barbra Streisand and Ryan O'Neal, before his depression-era road trip film Paper Moon, which won 10-year-old Tatum O'Neal an Oscar.\u00a0", "His turbulent personal life was often in the spotlight, including his affair with Cybill Shepherd that began while producing The Last Picture Show while he was married to his close collaborator, Polly Platt.", "The director's girlfriend and model Dorothy Stratten was murdered\u00a0in 1980, before his subsequent marriage to her younger sister Louise who was 29 years younger.", "Reactions poured in at the news of his death.", "", "
Bogdanovich's 1971 common-of-age drama The Last Picture Show was nominated for eight Oscars.\u00a0(AP: Chris Pizzello/Invision/File)
", "\"I'll never forget attending a premiere for The Last Picture Show.", "\"I remember at its end, the audience leaped up all around me bursting into applause lasting easily 15 minutes.", "\"I'll never forget although I felt I had never myself experienced a reaction like that, that Peter and his film deserved it.", "Actor Tatum O'Neal shared a post on social media.", "Mexican film director Guillermo del Toro also paid tribute.", "\"He was a dear friend and a champion of cinema.", "\"He birthed masterpieces as a director and was a most genial human.", "\"He single-handedly interviewed and enshrined the lives and work of more classic filmmakers than almost anyone else in his generation,\" he said in a tweet.\u00a0", "Bogdanovich was born in Kingston, New York in 1939 and began his career as a film journalist and critic.", "Working as a film programmer at the Museum of Modern Art, he endeared himself to a host of veteran filmmakers including Orson Welles, Howard Hawks and John Ford.", "\"I've gotten some very important one-sentence clues like when Howard Hawks turned to me and said, \"Always cut on the movement and no one will notice the cut,\" he said in an interview.", "Bogdanovich's Hollywood education started early in life.", "At the age of five, his father took him to see Charlie Chaplin and Buster Keaton movies at the Museum of Modern Art.", "He'd later make his own Keaton documentary, The Great Buster, which was released in 2018.", "Over the years he authored several books about movies, including\u00a0Peter Bogdanovich's Movie of the Week, Who the Devil Made It: Conversations with Legendary Film Directors and Who the Hell's in It: Conversations with Hollywood's Legendary Actors.", "He also acted, playing himself in\u00a0Moonlighting and How I Met Your Mother and playing other people, such as Dr\u00a0Elliot Kupferberg on The Sopranos, while inspiring a new generation of filmmakers, from Wes Anderson to Noah Baumbach.", "Even with his Hollywood-sized ego, Bogdanovich was humble.\u00a0", "\"I don't judge myself on the basis of my contemporaries,\" he told The New York Times in 1971.", "AP"]
